campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
There will be risks and challenges with each of the products that are offered on the various tiers.

First is the game - The art and rules are 100% complete, so the printing process will be ready to go once the Kickstarter has ended. The only problems that may occur would be manufacturer issues. We have decided to go Shuffled Ink as our offset game printer. From what we have read and from my own experiences, they usual have little to no issues with fulfillment. Though it is not unheard of for there to be issues when mass printing card games no matter what company you go through. 

Second is the custom artwork - The problems that would occur with this is if all 25 slots got filled for custom cards. This will take time to get the pictures from everyone and then draw their card of choice. With that said, we are confident that all artwork and custom cards will be finished and delivered by December 2019.

Third is the 3D printed Hero Cat - As displayed in the pictures above, the 3D Hero Cat figurine has been tested, printed and painted. The 3D printer is ready to get the job done. The only problem with this if the painter has troubles with keeping paint in stock. Luckily we have limited this tier to only 25 backers so there shouldn't be too much to worry about.

Overall we are confident in the conversations we have had with printing companies and others that have agreed to help fulfill this Kickstarter once it is successful. It is up to all of you guys now to make it happen. Lets get this game out there and have some fun. Thank you all, you are amazing.

Shipping - There is a little confusion with how shipping is going to be fulfilled as of right now. Currently we are planning on shipping through "stamps.com" they are a company that helps lower shipping costs for businesses. They have competitive rates compared to using the standard USPS.

Demo only available on Windows and Mac
Inmortis is a Topdown Action-RPG in pixel art planned for Windows / Mac and Linux. In this twisted world inspired from Warhammer and the Chtulhu Mythos, you will have to choose your way and find out what happened to the world around you.
Back from the dead after being sacrificed during a bloody ritual to bring old and forgotten deities into your reality, Inmortis invites you to discover a mystical world that changes depending on your actions.
Throughout your journey, you will face difficult choices that will make you question your morality along with challenging battles in which each mistake can lead to a horrible death...
This game isn't a Hack & Slash where you're gonna make your way through countless enemy hordes rushing at you, the gameplay is rather slow, but that doesn't mean it's not dynamic or breathtaking during tough fights. 
We designed this game to be the perfect mix between brutal and unforgiving combat, and a deep narrative core where the player's actions will really have an impact on the story.
 A challenge - This game is easy to pick up and the controls are simple to learn, but in order to master it and finish the game you’ll have to use clever tactics and take advantage of your environment and equipment to adapt to every situation.
 Highly customizable gameplay - Play with a variety of builds; lots of weapons to use, fully customizable equipment, and many spells and abilities to use in order to be ready for any situations. Choose wisely how to prepare yourself for each encounter.
 Face difficult choices - During your journey, you’ll quickly realize that neither pure good  nor evil exists in this game, in fact, these are relative concepts and you’ll have to make sacrifices in order to save your soul.
 Handcrafted World - While we love good roguelikes, procedurally generated levels mean we can’t really control what the player will be facing, that’s why we created each of the levels pixel by pixel to offer the best experience to the player. 
 Highly replayable - The world itself doesn’t change, but it can be seen in two different ways. As your corruption increases, you’ll see a totally different world, and you’ll get random effects, each one with a specific buff and debuff, that will greatly change how you experience the game each time.
“The oldest and strongest emotion of mankind is fear, and the oldest and strongest kind of fear is fear of the unknown."
H. P. Lovecraft
Since our childhood, we’ve always been told stories about ancient, powerful and feared deities, long lost in the past. Most of us think they are just legend, born from some archaic beliefs, and refuse to see the truth. 
But some are convinced these gods exists, and dedicate their life to bring them into our world. Those who take part in the ritual, should they be a cultist or a sacrifice, are all rewarded, and are tasked by their masters to rule this world while they feed on the reality itself.
The player will take the role of the Offering, the last sacrifice used to bring these gods into our plane of existence, and is rewarded with immortality, but at a cost: as long as they exist in this reality, the player will slowly get corrupted by their influence, driving  him to insanity...
To escape this fate, you'll have to find the cultists who killed you before the events of the game, now ascended to Servant-Kings, powerful demigods at the service of a specific deity, and banish them or absorb their powers.
But depending on your choices, you'll face consequences, as your body is alive only thanks to the Gods influence, the more you banish their servants, the more death and decay will spread around you, but at the same time absorbing their power will grant you an improved vitality at the cost of your sanity... 
Niynth The Blind Whisperer, Quod the Apostle of Bones, Vel the Golden Lord, Jing The Mirror of Perfection, Epulari the Fleshy Scholar, Primigenia The Fate Weaver, Sfagi the Almighty Champion, Oeka The Righteous Sinner
Each God represents an ambiguous concept, having both its good side with its qualities, and the exaggeration of these qualities. They cannot be considered truly evil, but at the same time most of those calling for their help end up facing dramatic consequences, often leading to insanity or death.
For example, asking Quod to bring back a loved one will reanimate this person. But over the days, the reanimated corpse will rot away and cause an eldritch plague to strike everyone coming in contact, creating fresh servants for the Apostle of Bones, for each deal with this God is doomed to end in entropy, death, disease and despair.
 Primary Weapons - Your main weapons, which can vary  from a sword, a pair of daggers to a two-handed greataxe or many others, depending on how you want to play. You can carry two different sets of weapons, and each one has a 3 hit combo, a dash attack and a special move for dual wielding and two-handed weapons.
 Secondary Weapons - If your left hand is free, you’ll have the possibility to equip yourself with a shield, a parrying dagger or other weapons allowing you to protect yourself or confuse your enemies.
 Spells and Active Items - Along with your weapons, you’ll find various items and spells you can use to turn a situation to your advantage. Hidden blades, Bombs, Blood swords or Blessings from a God are scattered across the world.
 Gift of the Gods -  Through your journey, you’ll inevitably gain corruption in one way or another. When accumulated for too long, corruption will manifest itself on the player, either physically or mentally, turning your blood into deadly acid, or changing you into a vampire, unable to heal but stealing the life of your foes.
Every time you die, you come back to life at the last tombstone you visited, thanks to the power of the gods. 
If this happens too many times, you may be gifted with a curse. It’s up to you to see it as a blessing or a burden…
It might allow you to slowly regenerate your health when you are not too wounded, but also slowly kill you if your health drops too low. Or you could bleed acid, damaging everyone walking in it, including you.
Of course, some of these effects can change how other abilities are working, for example a spell creating a sword made of your own blood to attack your foes will act completely different if your veins are filled with acid, dealing poison damage instead of magical damage, and leaving acid pools on the ground.
The more you get corrupted the more the world around you will change, allowing you to truly perceive all the darkest things that are usually invisible to mortal eyes; and some things are not meant to be discovered...

One thing very uncommon in a 2D pixel art game with complex animations, is the possibility of having your character entirely customizable, and we really wanted to have this feature in Inmortis.
That's why your character will change when you modify your equipment. In the inventory menu, you will be able to spread your loot between four dynamic equipment slots for your armor: head, torso, arms and legs. 
You also have two slots for your weapons, and you even have the possibility to equip a ring and an amulet. 
Each item has its own stats and bonuses, as well as a unique skin, granting you a large amount of possibilities to customize your look and experience ingame. 
You could go with a full heavy armor or mix it up with light and medium gear depending on your playstyle or fashion tastes ! 
Some armors and weapons you may find in the demo or later in the game
Each place you'll visit during your journey is dedicated to a specific God (with a few exceptions), and each one will react differently to your corruption.
These change can be only visual (like some lighting changing color, or strange flesh appearing in the environment) or really have a notable impact on the gameplay (new dangers appearing out of nowhere, some path getting blocked or freed)

At the begining, Inmortis was only a small project to make us work on something we would really love to play. Creating our own game from scratch with imagination as our only limit was like a dream for everyone in the team.
After working on it for 2 years, and with the community getting bigger everyday, the project followed the movement and got even more important for all of us. 
Today we want to be able to fully work on Inmortis, without having to spend too much time on a part-time job, and that’s why Kickstarter is the perfect solution for us. With your support we would be able to buy better gear and get external help from talented collaborators.
So far, this game has only been fueled by our own money,  funding the game on Kickstarter will allow us to realize the vision we have for Inmortis and keep a full creative control, and show the development process to the community by giving timely updates so we can make together a game that every fan of challenging Action-RPG would love to play !
Our main goals are:
Have the game funded so we can be sure we'll be able to reach the quality we're aiming for Inmortis
Gather feedbacks from fans and veteran of challenging Action-RPG games, since we're making a game for a very specific audience.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We started this project almost 2 years ago, some of us were already experienced in game development, while others realized step by step how gigantic was the amount of work required to build up a game like this...
We are working hard every day, and during countless sleepless nights, while struggling to survive the work rate between our full-time jobs and the game. 

During all this time the development was done without any budget or financing, and it was a truly exhausting experience.

We know that there are still many challenges to face until the day we'll be able to release a final version of the game, but after 2 years of development in these conditions, we feel confident that nothing can stop us :)

No matter the campaign result, we are going to finish this project. Financing will essentially speed up the development, and allow us to implement many features we would want Inmortis to have. We have already spent our own money on this project to make sure that we will be able to release it, but the number of features and the time we'll have to polish the game and reach the level of quality we're aiming for will be greatly influenced by the community support.

Our biggest concern is about schedule, we're a small but ambitious team, and even if we already planned our workflow to be able to deliver the game in time, we know that it is impossible to reduce the risks to zero.
Knowing this, we will talk with the community openly about any possible issues that might delay our development plans.

Lunark is a 2D cinematic platformer in the vein of '80s and '90s classics such as Prince of Persia and Flashback. Run, jump, hang, climb, roll, and shoot your way through mysterious alien ruins, a flying penitentiary, a high-tech megalopolis, and a majestic forest.
ALPHA GAMEPLAY FOOTAGE:
The game is at approximatively 15% through development. The purpose of the alpha footage below is to show Leo's move-sets and animations, some of the levels and the sound design. The UI is far from final and I'm working on new textboxes (improving the readability and including the portraits).  
I hope it'll give you a feel of the game's ambiance.
As Earth became inhospitable, Noah, an AI whose sole purpose was to preserve humanity, was created. Noah chose the Moon as humanity's Ark - renamed Lunark - using it as a ship to evacuate a handful of chosen ones to the nearest superhabitable planet. Unfortunately, whether the planet was inhabited or not was not part of Noah’s programming.
Centuries later, you play as Leo, an orphan rejected for being… different. You'll retrace your origins in the midst of a rebellion against the totalitarian regime of Lunark, and meet a wide cast of colorful characters, stuck on either side of the escalating conflict. 
I've designed Lunark as a homage to cinematic platformers while bringing modernity to a lot of the core aspects: The controls are responsive and intuitive and the progression system generous. The game is meant to feel fresh while being nostalgic. Lunark is also an adventure focused on delivering a thrilling narrative with explosive moments.
Sums up my main inspirations quite well...
The game will be available Nintendo Switch, PC (Windows) & Mac (OsX) in English, French, and Spanish. I hope to be able to add even more platforms and languages depending on how well the campaign and development goes. A survey will be sent to backers upon release to confirm platform choices.

“Cinematic platformers are action-adventure platformers with a strong emphasis on realism, cinematic presentation, detailed character animations, [...] and a minimalistic approach to storytelling”. (“The Cinematic Platformer Compendium” by itchyander)

campaign.story:
Here at Arrowstorm, we've made a few scifi films in the past, ranging from the action-creature-spectacle SURVIVOR, to post-apocalyptic zombie films like OSOMBIE and WE ALL FALL DOWN, to the cerebral space odyssey MAGELLAN. Now we bring you something completely new - 626 EVOLUTION - a present-day, urban, found-footage, scifi paranoid-thriller.
Directed by John Lyde, the visionary behind some of Arrowstorm's most beloved films - OSOMBIE, THE SHADOW CABAL, SURVIVOR, THE CHRISTMAS DRAGON and the last two MYTHICA films, 626 EVOLUTION stars fan-favorite Danielle Chuchran, back at her butt-kicking best.
As with all our past Kickstarter efforts, this film has already been shot and edited, and we are well into post-production. The trailer is actual footage from the film, so you can get a good gauge of the quality, and how close we are to fulfilling our vision.
Hunted by government agents and constantly assaulted by a cartel of vengeful thugs, an amnesiac known only as “626” searches for her true identity while protecting a teenage girl who shares her superhuman combat skills; but when 626 uncovers the horrifying truth about her past, she must infiltrate enemy headquarters to expose a corporate conspiracy that threatens the free world, before she and her companion are silenced forever.
  Danielle Chuchran - a rapidly rising action star, you've seen her decapitate zombies, massacre orcs, and cuddle puppies and ponies. Dani's back in fighting form, kicking butt and taking names.
Ruby Jones - if you're an Arrowstorm fan, you'll recognize this talented young actress from her roles in Survivor and Christmas Dragon. Now she'll do something unexpected...
Filmmaking is expensive business, and there’s no way we’d be able to make awesome indie fantasy and sci-fi films without the support of our community of fans and backers. Kickstarter is an invaluable resource which not only allows us to fund our films, but also lets us do it while connecting directly with fantasy and sci-fi fans like you! 
We’ve been able to make some really fun films, all because of your contributions. We want to do that again, and again, and again!
With Kickstarter it’s all or nothing. Backers pledge an amount and choose a reward. At the end of our 30-day Kickstarter campaign, if the total of all pledges for our project meets or exceeds our goal, then the credit cards of those who pledge are charged and we receive the funding. If not, we receive nothing, nobody gets charged, but everybody is sad :( 
We're not looking for charity, we're looking for an early sales venue - that's why our rewards reflect fair market value. Don't think of it as a donation, think of it as a pre-purchase. If you want to see this film, buy it now through Kickstarter - you'll probably get a better deal from us than from whatever retailer ends up selling it in your country. PLUS, our films release at all different times around the world. Our Kickstarter backers usually get to see the finished product months ahead of the general public. 
We're a small group of independent filmmakers who love making movies, and have been at it for about a decade. It's our full-time job, and every film we have made has received worldwide distribution. We do pretty much everything ourselves, from conception to financing to production to securing distribution. We love fantasy and science fiction and know there’s others out there like us, who we aim to please. 
We've done several films on Kickstarter in the past - including The Crown and the Dragon, Osombie, The Shadow Cabal, Orc Wars, Survivor, The Christmas Dragon and Mythica 1 - 5, and most of our supporters keep coming back, which means we're doing something right :) 
Click on a name to see our IMDB profiles: 
John Lyde - Director/Producer
Jason Faller - Executive Producer
Kynan Griffin - Executive Producer 
You can learn more about our film-making philosophy and our projects at our website: www.arrowstormentertainment.com
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Film is a complicated technical exercise, and often unforeseen difficulties arise, causing budget and scheduling overruns - particularly when complex visual effects are involved. That being said, we are an experienced group and have successfully completed and released every film we have started - over 20 of them now. We have produced several visual effects heavy projects in the past, and see no reason why we shouldn't continue to accomplish our goals.

On the plus side, this film is largely complete. A great deal of the risk in the project has already been mitigated, and we are too far along to turn back and give up. We are seeking funding to complete a visual effects sequence, and have the personnel to pull it off, regardless of complications.

campaign.story:
MAGELLAN is the first cerebral science fiction film from Arrowstorm Entertainment, a world leader in fantasy entertainment. Sure, we've made some sci-fi action movies (Survivor, Osombie and Zombie Hunter), but now we're talking NASA, artificial intelligence, quantum entanglement, Fermi's paradox, mysterious signals from space and an awesome onboard computer voiced by Matthew Mercer!
As with all our past Kickstarter efforts, this film has already been shot and edited, and we are well into post-production. The trailer is actual footage from the film, so you can get a good gauge of the quality, and how close we are to fulfilling our vision.
  After NASA picks up a trio of mysterious signals from within our own solar system, astronaut Roger Nelson is dispatched on a multi-year solo mission aboard the Magellan spacecraft to investigate the sources. What he discovers will change our understanding of science and our place in the universe, but the journey will have lasting consequences on Nelson and the wife he left behind.
  We’ve never attempted anything like this before. Inspired by the works of people like Carl Sagan and Arthur C. Clark, we wanted to create a "hard" science fiction film about space exploration, based on real science and theoretical situations. Every aspect of the story had to be carefully researched. We even brought in a former member of NASA’s Jet Propulsion Laboratory to advise us on astronautics and planetary science. The result is a mind-blowing space thriller about possible first contact, and we’re really excited to share it!
We've also partnered with some awesome people to bring the story to life, including VFX guru Cecil B. (Guardians of the Galaxy) and film composer Nathaniel Drew (who studied at one point under the tutelage of a certain Hans Zimmer).  We are also featuring music by VanLadyLove!    
  Brandon Ray Olive plays Commander Roger Nelson, a by-the-book astronaut whose wanderlust drives him to the stars. Brandon’s talent as a performer has landed him multiple roles in both film and television including NCIS, CSI:NY and Tyler Perry’s Single Mom’s Club. Recently he’s been cast in two projects from director Steven Soderbergh: Logan Lucky and HBO’s Mosaic. 
Matthew Mercer voices Ferdinand, the deep-spacecraft Magellan’s primary A.I. unit. Matthew is a talented actor and voice artist, best known for his voice work in countless franchises including Attack on Titan, World of Warcraft, Call of Duty, Final Fantasy...basically, if you’ve played a video game, you’ve heard Matthew’s voice. He’s also Dungeon Master supreme over at Critical Role, and of course played the evil necromancer Szorlok in our own Mythica series. 
Danor Gerald plays NASA project director Gerald Becker, and brings to the role a perfect blend of intellectual authority and tweed-jacket wearing geekiness. Danor has appeared in multiple roles including ABC’s Blood and Oil, Forever Strong and was the leading man in Saints and Soldiers: The Void.
Nicola Posener brings to life the voice of Neil, the deep-spacecraft MAGELLAN's cheeky, secondary A.I. unit. Arrowstorm fans will know her from her starring role in the Dawn of the Dragon Slayer and the Mythica franchise, but this may be the first time you hear her full American accent! She’s starred in several British films, and you can see her in the upcoming TV series Age of the Living Dead.
Whitney Palmer plays Abigail Nelson, NASA A.I. specialist and spouse to Commander Nelson. This marks Whitney’s first major role in a feature film, and she drives home an emotional performance as the “astronaut wife” left behind for a decade. 
Filmmaking is expensive business, and there’s no way we’d be able to make awesome indie fantasy and sci-fi films without the support of our community of fans and backers. Kickstarter is an invaluable resource which not only allows us to fund our films, but also lets us do it while connecting directly with fantasy and sci-fi fans like you! 
We’ve been able to make some really fun films, all because of your contributions. We want to really take it to the next level now, and are confident we can blow you away if you give us a chance. 
With Kickstarter it’s all or nothing. Backers pledge an amount and choose a reward. At the end of our 30-day Kickstarter campaign, if the total of all pledges for our project meets or exceeds our goal, then the credit cards of those who pledge are charged and we receive the funding. If not, we receive nothing, nobody gets charged, but everybody is sad :( 
We're not looking for charity, we're looking for an early sales venue - that's why our rewards reflect fair market value. Don't think of it as a donation, think of it as a pre-purchase. If you want to see this film, buy it now through Kickstarter - you'll probably get a better deal from us than from whatever retailer ends up selling it in your country. PLUS, our films release at all different times around the world. Our Kickstarter backers usually get to see the finished product months ahead of the general public. 
    We're a small group of independent filmmakers who love making movies, and have been at it for about a decade. It's our full-time job, and every film we have made has received worldwide distribution. We do pretty much everything ourselves, from conception to financing to production to securing distribution. We love fantasy and science fiction and know there’s others out there like us, who we aim to please. 
We've done several films on Kickstarter in the past - including The Crown and the Dragon, Osombie, The Shadow Cabal, Orc Wars, Survivor, The Christmas Dragon and Mythica 1 - 5, and most of our supporters keep coming back, which means we're doing something right :)

The Mythica series follows the adventures of Marek, a wizard born with the dark power of necromancy, as she learns to harness the power that threatens to corrupt her. She recruits a team of adventurers to battle Szorlok, the legendary Necromancer, and thwart his goal of uniting the four shards of the Darkspore to unleash an undead plague on the land.
The Godslayer
As the Lich King's zombie legions ravage the world, a cursed young sorceress (Marek) embarks on a quest to obtain a weapon from the gods, with her friend Dagen, a self-serving half-elf rogue. But when she joins her sworn enemy in a desperate attempt to save the world, she must recover the good in herself before her friends are all dead, and defeat the Lich King before the gods are destroyed and the world forever enslaved.

Like Melanie, Jake is a rapidly rising newcomer to the screen, but has spent years of his life immersed in fantasy role-playing games... so that also counts, right? Since Mythica, he has gone on to starring roles in Cyborg X, The Christmas Dragon and War Pigs.

Mythica 1: A Quest for Heroes, Mythica 2: The Darkspore and Mythica 3: The Necromancer have been completed and all rewards have been shipped to our wonderful Kickstarter Backers.
And now, we're super excited to share Mythica 4: The Iron Crown - the most epic Mythica film yet!
You can learn more about Mythica at: http://www.MythicaMovie.com
The Mythica series follows the adventures of Marek, a wizard born with the dark power of necromancy, as she learns to harness the power that threatens to corrupt her. She recruits a team of adventurers to battle Szorlok, the legendary Necromancer, and thwart his goal of uniting the four shards of the Darkspore to unleash an undead plague on the land.
The Iron Crown
When a team of unlikely heroes hijacks a steam-powered battle wagon, a daring young wizard (Marek) steals the final piece of the all-powerful Darkspore and embarks on a desperate quest to deliver the cursed artifact to the gods for safe keeping; but when they are caught in a death race between a ruthless team of elite mercenaries and a trinity of demons, Marek must learn to believe in herself before her friends are killed and the Darkspore is lost, to stop the evil necromancer (Szorlok) from uniting the Darkspore and flooding the living world with his legions of undead.
Watch the trailers for the first three Mythica films below!
Melanie Stone plays Marek, an escaped slave and natural-born necromancer. Stone is a brilliant new actress, with Mythica marking her first starring role, having played supporting roles in Christmas for a Dollar and Survivor. Since filming Mythica, she has starred in The Christmas Dragon, Riot, and Miracle Maker.
Kevin Sorbo makes his long-awaited return to the fantasy genre as Gojun Pye, legendary wizard and mentor to Marek. Kevin is best known to his scifi and fantasy fans for his starring roles in Hercules: The Legendary Journeys, Kull the Conqueror and Andromeda.
Matthew Mercer plays Szorlok, the Dark Lord - making his long-awaited appearance in the Mythica franchise, with many more sinister deeds to come. Matthew is a talented actor and voice artist, best known for his voice work in countless franchises... basically, if you've played a video game, you've heard Matthew's voice. He is also Dungeon Master supreme over at Critical Role, and just DM'd for no less than Vin Diesel. Not too shabby.
Adam Johnson plays Thane, a grizzled warrior and veteran of many wars. Adam can be seen in a myriad of projects, including the Veronica Mars movie, Dexter, Vamp U, Orc Wars, Once I was a Beehive and Dudes and Dragons.
Jake Stormoen stars as Dagen, a half-elf rogue. Like Melanie, Jake is a rapidly rising newcomer to the screen, but has spent years of his life immersed in fantasy role-playing games... so that also counts, right? Since Mythica, he has gone on to starring roles in Cyborg X, The Christmas Dragon and War Pigs.
The film is already shot, and we are hard at work on post-production. Sound, music and VFX are all under way. But we still have a TON of visual effects shots to pull off - whole green-screen sequences, lots of magic, giant CGI sets, zeppelins, etc. We want Mythica to be as good as it can be, so every extra dollar we can get helps us make the movie more awesome. Which brings us to you... we need your support to grow our VFX budget and allow us to actually get this done.
We especially want to make the magic effects better in this film... if you use the trailer as a guide, you'll see examples of our efforts to improve the look of our magical effects.
Backers pledge an amount and choose a reward. At the end of our 30-day Kickstarter campaign, if the combined total of all pledges for our project meets our $75,000 goal, then the credit cards of those who pledge are charged and we receive the funds to finish our film. If we don't meet our goal, then the money is not withdrawn from your account and no rewards are provided :(. If we exceed our $75,000 goal then the extra funds will be used to make the movie even better - so keep pledging! All funds raised are used directly in the finishing of this film.
We're not looking for charity, we're looking for an early sales venue - that's why our rewards reflect fair market value. Don't think of it as a donation, think of it as a pre-purchase. If you want to see this film, buy it now through Kickstarter - you'll probably get a better deal from us than from whatever retailer ends up selling it in your country, and you'll help make our film better!
As the campaign progresses, we'll add some more fun rewards - unique props, etc as additional incentives.
We're a small group of independent filmmakers who love making movies, and have been at it for about a decade. It's our full-time job, and every film we have made has received worldwide distribution. We do pretty much everything ourselves, from conception to financing to production to securing distribution. We love fantasy and science fiction and know there are others out there like us, who we aim to please.
We've done several films on Kickstarter in the past - including The Crown and the Dragon, Osombie, The Shadow Cabal, Orc Wars, Survivor, The Christmas Dragon and Mythica 1 - 3, and most of our supporters keep coming back, which means we're doing something right :)

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Film is a complicated technical exercise, and often unforeseen difficulties arise, causing budget and scheduling overruns. That being said, we are an experienced group and have successfully completed and released every film we have started. We have produced several visual effects heavy projects in the past, and see no reason why we shouldn't continue to accomplish our goals.

On the plus side, this film is largely complete. A great deal of the risk in the project has already been mitigated, and we are too far along to turn back and give up. We are seeking funding to complete post-production, and have the personnel to pull it off, regardless of complications.

And, we are proud to declare that Arrowstorm has delivered on every Kickstarter we have ever funded that has come due for delivery, 9-out-of-9!

campaign.story:
A beautiful 2D ARPG throwback to retro greats. Dark Flame brings you the perspective of a knight who must battle the horrific conveyance of unknown evil that has overtaken his order. Featuring large, hand-crafted environments, tailored gameplay, and an armoire of weapons, armor, and magic, the game blends classic with new to bring a unique experience!
You play the role of Taharial; a crusader in the midst of the Batlic Crusades. Upon discovering a mysterious onset of insanity by unknown causes amongst his brothers, Taharial sets forth to purge the area of evil and persevere through the dark possessive powers before all is lost in chaos.
PLAY

  For centuries, humanity's greatest willed champions, the Keepers of the Flame, have been tasked with containing the Dark Flame, an entity of unknown origins and purpose. Since its discovery, The Dark Flame has poisoned the souls of weak-minded humans, causing instant violent reactions and sacrificial behavior. Discovery of ancient texts gave humanity the tools, technology, and rituals to restrain the Dark Flame; mankind finally had the chance to protect themselves from the assumed destruction, and the Dark Flame was kept secret from all but the elite tier of Crusaders and the Church over the course of countless generations. After a bright light flashes from the fortress guarding the flame, reports of brutal slaughters in the neighboring town have the people desperate for help. The Church responds by dispatching Taharial, a potential candidate for the Keepers of the Flame, to investigate and protect the townspeople. The mission is clear: Find the members of the Keepers of the Flame, investigate the nature of the light flash, and save the townsfolk from the raiding monsters that have started appearing; the way, however, is not so well lit. When a young man steps into the ranks, his exceptional skills and ability to withstand the temptation of the Flame have his peers heralding that he, Islude, may be the person to eradicate the flame.
Taharial being dispatched to protect the townspeople
Utilize the Pyre to modify the powers of your weapons and spells  
Manipulate the unique level system to suit your style of play
Immerse yourself in the diverse storyline of Dark Flame where you struggle between the lesser of evils
Adorn powerful weapons and armor to customize your appearance
Discover hidden chambers and uncover dark secrets
Unlock unique talents and channel hidden powers
The Pyre - where you can augment your character and create spells!
The ancient texts gave men the knowledge and ability to forge weapons and spells at Pyres. Harnessed only by the Keepers of the Flame, the Pyres can attune magic crystals, allowing the player to craft new, more powerful spells, equipable to Taharial.
Taharial gazes into the Pyre while it attunes one of the magic crystals
The Pyres will also be used to forge more powerful weapons from the ones you already have, imbuing them with dynamic properties. There is an ancient writing on the use of Pyres. They contain much power of which the source is unknown. This power can be contained within “Magic Crystals” after attuning the crystals with the Pyre. Once these Magic Crystals have been attuned, they can be carried and used by those who have the power to use them.
Taharial using the power of the Pyre to enhance the power of his sword
The Pyres have also been known to imbue a portion of its power within other items as well. The most commonly used are weapons of the Keepers of the Flame. The ritual used to attune these weapons are another closely kept secret of the Keepers.
While front-swinging swords are the main weapon in the Pre-Alpha, they are most certainly not the only armaments you will get to use against the horde of horrors ahead. Tools such as crossbows, polearms, hammers, greatswords, daggers, and a slew of other forged steel arms with many different attack patterns and various sizes that will help you claw or club your way to victory. Yes, Shields will an addition to the game; We wouldn't want you to go around not defending yourself, would we? There will be an extra space for this kind of equipment on Tahrial, and a shield may be your best friend when defending from those poison-spitters! At the moment, the plan is to implement shield similar to Dark Souls; defending bleeds stamina, meaning you have to juggle attacks and protecting yourself with some care.
Taharial swinging a giant sword over his head to take down multiple enemies in one fell swoop
A future change you will see (Hopefully in the Alpha or Beta) is a revamping of sub-weapons. We wanted to do something that was a bit more in line with the theme of the game, so we are looking into changing the genre-standard items with glass fire bulbs. These little anachronisms will contain different elements, alchemy, and bric-a-brac and can be lobbed in different patterns depending on the bulb type. Once a bulb hits an enemy, it can break and spread the contents around, potentially doing more damage.
Taharial wielding a shield to protect himself from the various types of hazardous projectiles
Armor won't only increase stats, but will change the physical appearance of Taharial!
There are many other features that could be put into this project pending stretch goals! Make sure to check them out below!
I started working on Dark Flame over 2.5 years ago when I first started building the engine. My initial goal was to create a custom engine that would run with both efficiency and performance! After playing around with some pixel art, I realized I would need something better than my less-than-mediocre art to really make this project come to life. That's when I invested over $5500 of my personal money to work with three artists and a musician to bring you the wonderfully made pre alpha that you can download for free (HERE)! This sacrifice of both time and money is my investment to you, as backers, to hopefully gain your trust in knowing that I am fully invested in this project!
Having some fun showing off the game with various individuals!
I have been a huge fan of video games since before I could pick up a controller. I was such a huge fan, I ended up teaching myself how to program and put as much effort into a game engine as possible. I am not merely making this game for profit - I'm doing it because I have a passion to do so. The funding received will directly go towards the success of this project!
Before (left) and After (right) - one of the reasons I'm relying on Kickstarter
                                                                                    I am turning to Kickstarter to hire on a few professionals to polish up this game and get it to the players (you) as soon as possible. I have already tried and tested each and every one of them and put their beautiful work into the playable demo with my own personal funding. Unfortunately, hiring people who are good at what they do, is a bit expensive. With your help, I can turn Dark Flame from a dream, to a reality. I just need your support in backing this project and allowing us to finish this masterpiece!
Warren (http://darkflamegame.com/) has been a hobbyist programmer since 2005. He has always fooled around with art and music but his passion has always been in video games. Dark Flame is something that Warren has been working on during his free time while holding a full time job. He is now working on taking his dream off the back-burner and creating something amazing... with your help!
Will (http://unsilentwill.com/) is a trained painter and sculptor who while playing games as a kid drew creatures and stories to explore, learning from history and myth to build living worlds from pixels.
Bryan (http://www.bldaudio.com/) has been making music in some form or fashion his entire life - from his incessant humming of video game music as a child, to seeing his works performed live on stage. He plays and teaches all styles of guitar, specializing in Jazz, Classical, and Progressive Metal. Bryan also loves the piano, synthesizers, other stringed instruments, percussion...basically anything that makes noise!
Greg (http://gregtaylorart.com/) was drawn to art from early childhood, his first exposure and fascination to fantasy art was upon commandeering his Father’s Frank Frazetta book. He traveled to the United Kingdom in 1995 where he studied traditional art & design. In 2007 he chose to pursue art professionally and began his career as a freelance artist. To date he’s worked with many clients producing art for a wide range of applications. Some of his largest contributions to projects have included Dead Frontier and Doom Warrior where he provided all Environmental, Character and Creature Concept Art, Promotional Illustrations, Storyboards and 2D Assets.
Cecilia "Cecihoney" (http://cecihoney.deviantart.com/) has been a spriter for more than 20 years. She loves giant robots, starships, sci fi, magic, and fantasy. Aside from pixelart she likes to write, build plastic models, customize toys, read, watch anime/cartoons, play video games, and roleplay… Her main influences come from 32bit era games, mostly Phantasy Star IV, Chrono Trigger, Secret of Mana, Megaman X, and Final Fantasy VI.
Loren (https://twitter.com/lorenlemcke) is a Mathematics graduate from the University of Arizona, where he studied mathematical simulations and models of crowd based behavior. He has been playing video games ever since he can remember and started programming from an early age as well, since his passion for mathematics went hand in hand with programming. He released his first solo commercial project, Over 9000 Zombies!, on Steam in February 2015.
Brian (http://www.twitch.tv/thatmoustachio) is a streaming personality who is self-charged with bringing the game to the forefront of the online media community. He has written and scripted for several online series and short films, and was drawn to the project not only due to his undying love for Metroidvania titles, but for the vast scope the story could be. This will be one of his largest projects yet, and he is excited for the challenge.
Tom (http://www.tomking.net) is a game designer and writer who believes the creative direction of a script should be at the forefront of a game's design regardless of its graphical complexity. Tom claims he has always had a fascination with video games, stating that his parents encouraged him to create fan stories and art of his favorite games growing up. Although Dark Flame will be his debut as a writer for video games, he is confident his love of the medium and experience with script writing will help him deliver a memorable tale.

We All Fall Down is a new series from Arrowstorm Entertainment, imagining a world built by children with just a brief window to live a full life. If Lord of the Flies and Walking Dead had a baby, this is what it'd look like.
Presented in ten episodes of about 8 to 10 minutes each, this Kickstarter campaign gives viewers the chance to get the whole series before it ever releases to the world, and to be a part of bringing this project to life.
